member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.CellExportingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Use to cancel the export of the cell.

remarks.p: If the cell export is cancelled, the text value of the cell will not be added to the grid but the table cell will still be added. This is necessary to make the columns line up.

Use this to override the default export with custom logic by manipulating the object yourself. Extra elements like images or extra text can be added to the export or the report cell itself can be manipulated.

This is only necessary when the structure of the cell needs to be changed. To just change the text that's being exported, use the property. To change the style of the cell set the style properties of the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.CellExportingEventArgs.ExportValue
member.summary: The value that will be exported to the cell in the report.

remarks.p: Set this to a new value if you want to change the text that will be displayed in the report. Use it to change the value that is exported without changing the value of the object that's being exported.
The value of the property may be set to any type of object. If this is set to an object that isn't a string, the result of the object's ToString() method will be displayed in the report cell.
If the ExportValue is changed, none of the formatting set on the column or on the editor will be reapplied before it is exported. The value will be exported exactly as it is.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.CellExportingEventArgs.HasExportValueChanged
member.summary: Tracks whether the ExportValue property has been changed during the event.

remarks.p: Returns true if the ExportValue property was changed and false if it's still the same as the value of the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.RowExportingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Use to cancel the export of the row.

remarks.p: If the row export is cancelled, the row's report element will not be added to the document. The row's cells will also not be exported and no cell exporting events will be fired.
Use this to override the default export with custom logic. Use the property to add different elements to the report instead.

Setting this property has the same effect as setting the property to true in the event. Rendering can be cancelled in either event but the other event fires first so cancelling the render there will save a little bit of processing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.DocumentExportInitializeRowEventArgs.SkipDescendants
member.summary: Skip the rendering of any child rows of the current row.

remarks.p: If this is set to true, no elements will be created in the document for child rows of the current row. To skip rendering only for a specific child row, set the property of the event argument to true when the event is fired for that row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.DocumentExportInitializeRowEventArgs.SkipRow
member.summary: Set to true to skip the rendering of this row.

remarks.p: Has the same effect as setting the property to true in the event. Rendering can be cancelled in either event but this event fires first so cancelling the render here will save a little bit of processing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.DocumentExportInitializeRowEventArgs.SkipSiblings
member.summary: Set to true to skip the rendering of the rest of the rows in the rows collection.

remarks.p: If this is set to true, the current row will be exported but none of the rest of the rows in the rows collection that haven't yet been exported will be exported. The rest of the rows in the rows collection will not be processed at all so none of the export events will be fired for them.
Footer rows are not affected. Footer rows will still be exported after the SkipSiblings property has been set to true. The event will also need to be cancelled to prevent the footers exporting.
Rows belonging to different rows collections in the same band will not be affected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.DocumentExportInitializeRowEventArgs.TerminateExport
member.summary: Skips the rest of the elements in the grid.

remarks.p: A report will be created containing all of the elements that have already been exported from the grid but no new elements will added to the export.

This will stop the UltraWebGridDocumentExporter from processing the rest of the elements in the document. All elements that haven't been exported including header rows, footer rows, new rows collections and group by rows will be affected. No more document exporting events except for will be fired.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.GraphicsCache
member.summary: Use the graphics cache to get Infragistics.Documents graphics objects like Backgrounds, Borders and Fonts.

remarks.p: The graphics class will translate from native .NET objects like System.Drawing.Color, font names and line widths to objects that can be used with the Document generating framework.

It will also cache the objects that it creates to improve the performance of the framwork's drawing. When an object is requested for the first time it's created and any requests after that for a drawing object with the same properties will return the existing objects.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ReportRenderer
member.summary: The ReportRenderer class traverses the grid and exports all of the required grid elements to the document section that is provided to the constructor.

remarks.p: The ReportRenderer uses the grid's internal ability to be traversed as an Xml document to export the grid to a document provided by the UltraWebGridDocumentExporter object that is using it.

It uses the Xml representation of the grid so that grid features like column moving, filtering, data editors and sorting will automatically be applied. The elements of the grid automatically take most of the important grid settings into account when creating the XML document.

The ReportRendered exports the grid as closely to the way it appears in the browser as possible. It exports grid features like hierarchy, grouping, filtering, column moving and sorting. Styles that are set directly on the grid or through application styling will also be applied.

The way it works internally is very simple. It has Walk methods for traversing the Xml document and Export methods for creating elements in the document that is being generated. Each different element in the grid is created using an Export method and collections of objects like Rows, Cells and Footers are traversed using the Walk methods. Elements in the document are created using a ReportWrapper object that knows how to create report elements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ReportRenderer.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter,Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid,Infragistics.Documents.Report.Section.ISection,Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.StyleSheet)
member.summary: Creates a ReportRenderer object that can export the specified UltraWebGrid object to the ISection report section that has been provided.
member.param: A reference to the UltraWebGridDocumentExporter object that has has triggered the export. This is necessary so the events can be fired as the grid elements are exported.
The UltraWebGrid object that is to be exported. This will be exported as it is configured when the method is called.
The section of the report that the grid should be exported to.
The object containing all the stylesheet information.

member.summary: Triggers the export of the grid to the section that was provided to the constructor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ReportRenderer.WalkRows(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Iterates through the rows in a rows collection XML tag ("Rs") and exports each row to the document that's being generated.

remarks.p: This overload is used for rows collection where styling isn't applied. It's used for rows collections of rows with children and the rows collections of GroupByRows. Use the overload with the style parameters to export the rows collection for the first band with a styled border.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ExportResources.FontDirectory
member.summary: Provides the path to a directory containing the files for fonts that should be included in the document but aren't installed on the server.

remarks.p: Use the FontDirectory to provide the report generator with fonts that aren't installed on the server.

The FontDirectory property should give the location of a directory in the local file system from where extra font files that should be embedded into the document can be loaded. The FontDirectory can point to an absolute directory path (c:\settings\fonts) or a path relative to the current ASP.NET page (~/fonts/styles).

Setting a font directory is optional. If the FontDirectory property is null, the report generator will not try to load extra font files from the file system. It is possible to use a combination of fonts from the FontDirectory and fonts from the operating system. You only need to add fonts to the FontDirectory that aren't installed in the operating system.

When setting a FontDirectory make sure that the property is not set to None. Fonts that are not likely to be included in the end user's system must be embedded or they will be displayed as the default font for the PDF reader if they are not found on the user's system.

The report generator only supports TrueType (.ttf) font files. Any other files in the FontDirectory will be ignored. The document export will only look for fonts in the directory that is provided. It will not do a recursive search.

Embedding extra fonts requires the application to have Full Trust on the web server. An exception will be thrown if it is attempted by a web application running at Medium Trust or lower. If the web application is running in Medium Trust, fonts can't be embedded and the FontDirectory must be null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ExportResources.FontDirectoryResolved
member.summary: Returns the full file path of the FontDirectory. Resolves any relative paths.

remarks.p: For internal use only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.ExportResources.FontsEmbedded
member.summary: Determines whether or not font files should be embedded in the document.

remarks.p: When fonts are embedded, the font file information will be included in the report file so that the correct font will be displayed even on machines where it isn't installed. When fonts are embedded into the document they will be sure to display correctly on all end user. If the fonts aren't embedded, fonts that can't be loaded will be displayed using the report reader's default font instead.

The disadvantage of embedding fonts is that it makes the document files considerably larger than they would be otherwise. If you are using only standard operating system fonts that will be installed on most end users machines or if file size is a big consideration, it is worth setting the property to None.

The recommended setting for this property is EmbedFonts.ResourceFontsOnly where fonts that are loaded from the will be embedded into the document but the other standard operating system fonts will be loaded from the end user's machine. If you aren't using any fonts that are loaded from the FontDirectory, setting the property to ResourceFontsOnly will be the same as setting the property to None.

Embedding fonts requires full trust on the web server. An exception will be thrown if the web application is running in medium trust. If the web application is running in medium trust, the FontsEmbedded property must be set to None and font names will be added to the document but the fonts themselves need to be installed on the end users machine for the font to display.
It is not possible to set the FontsEmbedded property on a per-style basis. It can only be set for the entire control.
Font information will only be included if the supports it. This means that font information will be included for PDF or XPS documents but not for PlainText files.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter
member.summary: The UltraWebGridDocumentExporter control provides PDF and XPS document exporting functionality to the .

remarks.p: You need to call the control's method to trigger the export. This is usually done in response to an action like a button click.
The export can be customized by setting the properties of the document exporter control. Some of the most common properties to set are:

list.item: Format - whether to export as a PDF, XPS or text document.
DownloadName - the name of the file after it is downloaded
ExportMode -how the report will be sent to the browser.
DataExportMode - how to export grids with paging or load on demand enabled.

remarks.p: You can also use the control's events to customize the export.

list.item: The BeginExport and EndExport events can be used to add extra information to the section that the grid is being exported to.
The CellExporting and RowExporting events can be used to customize the rows that are exported.
The InitializeRow event can be used to cancel the export for particular rows or groups of rows.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.#ctor
member.summary: UltraWebGridDocumentExporter object constructor.

remarks.p: Use this to programmatically create an UltraWebGridDocumentExporter object at runtime. Make sure that you set the object's ID property and add it to the form's control collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Dispose
member.summary: Performs final clean-up before the control is released from memory by the garbage collector.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Export(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid)
member.summary: Used to trigger the export of the grid. Usually is called in response to a user action like a button click.

remarks.p: Use this export method if you want the grid to be exported to a new report. The export method will automatically create a new report with one section. A reference to the section will be returned from the method.

The exported document will be saved to the page's Response stream. The report will be sent to the browser and the user will be prompted to either view it in the browser or download it depending on the control's setting.

The export will not happen at the time when the export method is called. For grids that are exported to the response stream, the export will happen when the page's Render method is called. The control is designed like this to give the rest of the page life cycle a chance to run before the document is exported to the response stream. This is necessary to support application styling.

Because of the delayed way the export works, each document exporter control can only export one grid per postback. If you need to export multiple grids to the same document, you will need to use a separate UltraWebGridDocumentExporter control for each grid and pass a reference to the same Report each time you call the Export() method. Make sure you set the property to Custom for all of the UltraWebGridDocumentExporter controls except for the first because only the first control will need to export the document to the page's Response stream.
The UltraWebGridDocumentExporter has some limitations and does not export all grid features as they would appear in the browser.

list.item: Templated columns will not be exported. It is not possible for the document exporter to know how to recreate the contents of a templated column in PDF so any templated columns will be excluded from the export.
Any HTML formatting that is set as the value of a string cell will be exported as a literal string rather than being applied as formatting.
Checkbox columns will display as a true/false value rather than as a checkbox
StationaryMarginsOutlookGroupBy settings are currently ignored
Header layouts are ignored. Grids with header layouts will be exported with one header per column
Header images are ignored. Column headers will be exported as normal just without the image that was supplied.

remarks.p: You can also export the grid to an existing section, an existing report or to a custom stream.

member.param: The UltraWebGrid control that is to be exported to the document.
member.returns: The section that the grid is being exported to.

member.summary: Exports the grid to a new section at the end of the provided report. Saves the report to the page's Response stream so it can be downloaded by the user's browser.

remarks.p: Use this export method if you want the grid to be exported to a new section at the end of an existing report. The section that is created is returned from the method. The document exporter creates the new section as soon as the Export() method is called so you can add more sections to the document after exporting the grid.

The exported document will be saved to the page's Response stream. The report will be sent to the browser and the user will be prompted to either view it in the browser or download it depending on the control's setting.

The export will not happen at the time when the export method is called. For grids that are exported to the response stream, the export will happen when the page's Render method is called. The control is designed like this to give the rest of the page life cycle a chance to run before the document is exported to the response stream. This is necessary to support application styling.

If you need to export multiple grids to the same document, you will need to use a separate UltraWebGridDocumentExporter control for each grid and pass a reference to the same Report each time you call the Export() method. Make sure you set the property to Custom for all of the UltraWebGridDocumentExporter controls except for the first because only the first control will need to export the document to the page's Response stream.
The UltraWebGridDocumentExporter has some limitations and does not export all grid features as they would appear in the browser.

list.item: Templated columns will not be exported. It is not possible for the document exporter to know how to recreate the contents of a templated column in PDF so any templated columns will be excluded from the export.
Any HTML formatting that is set as the value of a string cell will be exported as a literal string rather than being applied as formatting.
Checkbox columns will display as a true/false value rather than as a checkbox
StationaryMarginsOutlookGroupBy settings are currently ignored
Header layouts are ignored. Grids with header layouts will be exported with one header per column
Header images are ignored. Column headers will be exported as normal just without the image that was supplied.

remarks.p: You can also export the grid to an existing section or to a custom stream.

member.param: The UltraWebGrid control that is to be exported to the document.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Export(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the grid to a new report and saves the report to the provided stream.

remarks.p: Use this export method if you want the grid to be exported to a new report. The export method will automatically create a new report with one section. A reference to the section will be returned from the method.

The report will be saved to the stream provided. This can be used to save the report as a file, save it to a database as a binary object, save it to memory for further processing or send it over a network.

If you set the closeStream parameter to true, the stream will be automatically closed when the export has finished. Otherwise it is your responsibility to close the stream yourself. The best place to do this is usually in the event where the event argument will have a reference to the output stream.

Make sure the document exporter's is set to custom when you export to a stream. The property will automatically get set to Custom when you pass the Export() method a stream parameter. If you change it to Download or InBrowser after you call the Export() method, the report will be exported to the page's Response stream rather than to the stream you provided.

The export will not happen at the time when the export method is called. For grids that are to be exported to a custom stream, the export will happen when the page's PreRender event fires. The export can't happen until this point because the style information isn't complete until PreRender because of the way application styling works.

Because of the delayed way the export works, each document exporter control can only export one grid per postback. If you need to export multiple grids to the same document, you will need to use a separate UltraWebGridDocumentExporter control for each grid and pass a reference to the same Report each time you call the Export() method.

It's not necessary to pass an output stream to the exporter to do a custom export. If export mode is set to custom and no stream is provided, the grid will be generated in the report and then you can save the report yourself by calling it's publish() method. The event which will fire when the grid has finished exporting is a good place to do this.
The UltraWebGridDocumentExporter has some limitations and does not export all grid features as they would appear in the browser.

list.item: Templated columns will not be exported. It is not possible for the document exporter to know how to recreate the contents of a templated column in PDF so any templated columns will be excluded from the export.
Any HTML formatting that is set as the value of a string cell will be exported as a literal string rather than being applied as formatting.
Checkbox columns will display as a true/false value rather than as a checkbox
StationaryMarginsOutlookGroupBy settings are currently ignored
Header layouts are ignored. Grids with header layouts will be exported with one header per column
Header images are ignored. Column headers will be exported as normal just without the image that was supplied.

remarks.p: You can also export the grid to an existing section or to the page's response stream.

member.param: The UltraWebGrid control that is to be exported to the document.
A stream to save the generated report.
Whether to close the stream after the export is finished. If you pass false to this parameter, you can handle the event and close the stream yourself there.
member.returns: The section that the grid is being exported to.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Export
member.summary: Event handler for the page's PreRender event.

remarks.p: Call this method to trigger the export internally. This method configures the grid for export, collects all the style information and then calls RenderDocument to create the elements in the report. It can be accessed publically by calling the Export() overloads that take an UltraWebGrid object as a parameter.
This method fires the begin export method and binds to the grid to the complete data source if is set to AllInDataSource and LoadOnDemand or paging is turned on.

If the is set to Custom and a file stream is passed to the document exporter, the stream will be written straight away. If the ExportMode is set to Download or InBrowser, the report will be written to the response stream during the Render part of the page's lifecycle to give the rest of the page a chance to run.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.BeginExport
member.summary: Fires when the exporter begins the export process.

remarks.p: This event fires before any of the export logic is run. It will fire once for each time the Export() method is called.

Use the event to configure the grid before exporting. Applying changes here will ensure that they will be set before the exporter starts to export the grid. This can include things like applying styles, changing the grid header and footer options or grouping and ungrouping columns.

If you need to make changes to the styling of the grid it is important that you make them in the BeginExport method. No changes made to grid element styles in any events fired later in the export process will be applied to the grid because of the performance overhead of parsing the style information. Any style changes that you need to make in any of the other export events will need to be applied directly to the Report elements rather than to the grid elements.
The BeginExport event is not cancellable.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.EndExport
member.summary: Fires after the exporter has finished exporting the grid to the report.

remarks.p: Fires after the grid has been created in the report but before the report is written to a stream.
Use this event to do any post export processing on the exported report that is necessary before the report is written to the Page's Response stream.

It can be used to set any properties set in back to their original values if the page is going to be displayed again after a custom export. This isn't necessary if the report is going to be downloaded by the browser because the grid's HTML will never be sent back to the browser.
It can also be used to add any extra content to the section that should appear after the grid. Extra content can be added by calling the methods of the property of the event argument.
The EndExport event can't be cancelled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.InitializeRow
member.summary: Fires before the export of each row.

remarks.p: Use this event to choose which rows to export. You can cancel the export of the current row, the row's children, the rest of the row's siblings or the rest of the rows in the grid.
To cancel the export of the current row set the SkipRow property of the event argument to true. This will have the same effect as cancelling the event.

To cancel the export of the row's children set the SkipDescendants property to true. The current row will still be exported, but none of the row's child rows will be processed. This will have the same effect as cancelling the event for each of the child rows.

To cancel the export of the rest of the row's siblings set the SkipSiblings property of the event argument to true. This will cancel the export of any other rows in the same rows collection that haven't yet been export. It won't affect footer rows. You will need to cancel the event to cancel the export of the footers.

To cancel the rest of the rows in the grid set the TerminateExport property to true. This will stop the grid from exporting any more elements in the grid. No more document exporting events except for the will fire.

This event can also be used to configure the UltraGridRow before it is exported. For example the row's styles can be modified for export by setting the UltraGridRow's property. Any changes you make to the UltraGridRow object will be persisted after the export has finished so it might be more convenient to apply changes directly to the document objects in the event.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.RowExporting
member.summary: Fires before the row elements in the document are created. This event can be cancelled to stop the row being exported.

remarks.p: Use this event to customize the way the row is exported. You can add new elements to the document to appear before the current row or cancel the ReportExporting event and handle the export yourself.

This event can be cancelled to skip some rows during the export. This is the same as setting the SkipRow event argument property true in the event. For more control over which rows are to be exported use the InitializeRow event instead.

This event can also be used to adjust the row's properties before it exports. Any changes made to the UltraGridRow's property in this event will be applied to the exported row in the document. You can also apply style directly to the document objects as they are being exported in the event.
This event only fires for data rows and group by rows. It does not fire for header or footer rows. Handle the and events for header and footer rows.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.RowExported
member.summary: Fires after the row has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the export. You can add extra elements to the document using the property of the event argument. Any extra elements that are added will appear directly after the row that was exported.

This event can also be used to customize the row that was generated during the export using the property of the event argument. Style properties like Height and Margins can be adjusted after the entire row has been exported.
This event only fires for normal data rows and group by rows. It does not fire for header or footer rows. Handle the and events for header and footer rows.
This event won't be fired if the event was cancelled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.CellExporting
member.summary: Fires before a cell is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the cell being exported.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the way the cell is exported.

Set the event argument property to change the value of the exported cell. The value can be set to any type of object and the result of the ToString() method will be displayed in the cell. If ExportValue isn't set, the cell's formatted text will be displayed instead.

Use the property to customize the contents of the cell. You can use this to add new items to the exported cell or to completely override the way that the cell exports. If you want to completely override the cell's rendering, set the property to true to cancel the default export logic.
Styling set on the event argument property won't be applied to the exported cell. Apply any style changes that you want to make directly to the ReportCell.

This event can be cancelled by setting the property of the event argument to true. When the event is cancelled, the logic to export the contents of the cell won't be run but the cell element itself will still be created.
This event will only be fired for data cells in the grid. Handle the and events for header and footer cells.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.CellExported
member.summary: Fired after the cell has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Use this event to customize the way the cell is exported. Extra elements that appear after the cell's text can be added to the generated cell using the property of the event argument. Style properties of the ReportCell like Alignment, Background and Borders can also be modified.
This event will only be fired for data cells in the grid. Handle the and events for header and footer cells.
This event will not be fired if the event was cancelled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.HeaderRowExporting
member.summary: Fired before a header row is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the header from being exported to the document.

remarks.p: Handle this event to customize the way a header row is exported. Use the property of the event argument to add new elements to the document to appear before the current row.
Set the property to either skip exporting the header or so you can to handle the export yourself.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.HeaderRowExported
member.summary: Fired after a header row has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Handle this event to customize the way a header row is exported. Use the property of the event argument to add new elements to the document to appear after the header that was just exported.
You can also use the property of the event argument to customize the header row that was generated. You can adjust style properties like Height and Margins.
This event won't be fired if the event was cancelled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.HeaderCellExporting
member.summary: Fired before a header cell is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the header cell from being exported to the document.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the way the header cell is exported.

Set the event argument property to change the value of the exported header cell. The value can be set to any type of object and the result of the ToString() method will be displayed in the cell. If ExportValue isn't set, the column's header caption will be displayed instead.

Use the property to customize the contents of the cell. You can use this to add new items to the exported cell or to completely override the way that the cell exports. If you want to completely override the cell's rendering, set the property to true to cancel the default export logic.

This event can be cancelled by setting the property of the event argument to true. When the event is cancelled, the logic to export the contents of the header won't be run but the cell element itself will still be created.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.HeaderCellExported
member.summary: Fired after the header cell has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Use this event to customize the way the header cell is exported. Extra elements that appear after the cell's text can be added to the generated cell using the property of the event argument. Style properties of the ReportCell like Alignment, Background and Borders can also be modified.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.FooterRowExporting
member.summary: Fired before a footer row is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the footer from being exported to the document.

remarks.p: Handle this event to customize the way a footer row is exported. Use the property of the event argument to add new elements to the document to appear before the footer row.
Set the property to either skip exporting the footer or so you can to handle the export yourself.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.FooterRowExported
member.summary: Fired after a footer row has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Handle this event to customize the way a footer row is exported. Use the property of the event argument to add new elements to the document to appear after the footer that was just exported.
You can also use the property of the event argument to customize the footer row that was generated. You can adjust style properties like Height and Margins.
This event won't be fired if the event was cancelled.

member.summary: Fired before a footer cell is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the footer cell from being exported to the document.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the way the footer cell is exported.

Set the event argument property to change the value of the exported footer cell. The value can be set to any type of object and the result of the ToString() method will be displayed in the cell. If ExportValue isn't set, the footer's caption text will be displayed instead.

Use the property to customize the contents of the cell. You can use this to add new items to the exported cell or to completely override the way that the cell exports. If you want to completely override the cell's rendering, set the property to true to cancel the default export logic.

This event can be cancelled by setting the property of the event argument to true. When the event is cancelled, the logic to export the contents of the footer won't be run but the cell element itself will still be created.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.FooterCellExported
member.summary: Fired after the footer cell has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Use this event to customize the way the footer cell is exported. Extra elements that appear after the cell's text can be added to the generated cell using the property of the event argument. Style properties of the ReportCell like Alignment, Background and Borders can also be modified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.DownloadName
member.summary: Filename given to the document downloaded to the browser during export.

remarks.p: Use this property to customize the filename given to the document file when it is downloaded by the browser. If no filename is provided, the filename will be set to a default filename like document.pdf.

The filename must be a legal file name on the client's operating system and must end with the right file extension for the type of file that is being exported. If no file extension is provided, one will be automatically added based on the of the document.
The file extension used for each format are:

list.item: PDF documents: .pdf
XPS documents: .xps
Text documents: .txt

remarks.p: For security reasons, the property strictly filters the filename, and may truncate long filenames or those that specify a path.

The filename should not contain any path information because the place where the user will be prompted to save the file will depend on the browser. Path characters like slashes will be removed from the filename.

It is recommended that the download filename be dynamically determined by developers' web applications, because some versions of the Microsoft Internet Explorer browser may fail to open the spreadsheet as expected if a file of the same name already exists within the end user's Temporary Internet Files cache.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Format
member.summary: Determines whether to save the report as a PDF or XPS or plain text document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.AutoSizeRows
member.summary: Determines whether document rows and columns will be automatically resized to display contents of grid cells or if grid contents should be cropped.

remarks.p: When this is set to true, the height of the rows will increase to accommodate cells with text that is too long to be displayed.
When it is set to false, the height and width of the rows will be respected and any extra text will be clipped. Set this to false if you want to work out the width and height of the columns yourself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.TargetPaperOrientation
member.summary: Sets whether the section that the grid is exported to should have landscape or portrait paper orientation.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the page orientation for the pages that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different page orientations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.Margins
member.summary: Sets the size of the margins of the section that the grid is being exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the margin widths for the pages for the section that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different margin settings.
The margin sizes are measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like Narrow, Normal or Wide from the object or create a new PageMargins object with a custom size for each edge.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.TargetPaperSize
member.summary: Sets the size of the page that the grid will be exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the size of the pages for the section that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different page sizes.
The page size is measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like A3, A4 or A5 from the enumeration or create a new object with a custom width and height.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.ExportResources
member.summary: Contains information about external resources like fonts that are needed for the export.

remarks.p: Use this property to set the path to the directory that the should use to load external fonts and to change whether the fonts will be embedded in the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.DataExportMode
member.summary: Determines whether the grid will export the entire set of data if the grid has paging or LoadOnDemand enabled.

remarks.p: If paging or LoadOnDemand are enabled and the property is set to DataExportMode.AllDataInDataSource, the exporter control will bind the grid to the entire data source before exporting and create a document that contains all of the rows that would be displayed if paging or LoadOnDemand were not enabled. The grid will do this by disabling LoadOnDemand and paging and running the data binding logic again.

If the property is set to DataExportMode.DataInGridOnly, the grid will only export the rows that are currently visible in the grid. Use this if you only want to display the current page of data in a paged grid or if you only want to display the rows that the user has expanded using LoadOnDemand.
If your grid does not use paging or LoadOnDemand, it doesn't matter which setting you use. The grid will only try to bind to the entire data source if LoadOnDemand or Paging is enabled.

If you want to programmatically load a specific set of rows into your grid, set the DataExportMode to DataInGridOnly, handle the method and then load the required rows into your grid before the grid starts to export.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.TargetPaperSizeResolved
member.summary: Returns the height and width of the page in points.

remarks.p: It automatically takes page orientation into account so you don't need to worry about whether the page is in landscape or portrait mode. It also automatically adds any margins.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.DownloadNameResolved
member.summary: Looks

remarks.p: If a suggested name was set through the property, it is returned. Otherwise a default file name like document.pdf is generated and will be used.
If the suggested download name doesn't end with the right file extension for the document type (.pdf, .xps or .txt) then the file extension will be automatically added.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.DownloadExtension
member.summary: Returns the default download extension for the that is being exported.

remarks.p: Used by the GetDownloadName() method when it generates the download name from provided by the user and when it creates a default download name.
Returns "pdf" for PDF documents, "xps" for XPS documents and "txt" for PlainText documents. Returns an empty string if the FileFormat isn't recognised.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.MimeType
member.summary: Returns the MimeType that should be used for the that's being exported.

remarks.p: The mimetype that is used currently can not be changed.

The mimetype will be "application/pdf" for PDF documents, "application/vnd.ms-xpsdocument" for XPS documents and "text/plain" for PlainText documents. If Format is not recognised, the propery will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.DocumentExport.UltraWebGridDocumentExporter.About
member.summary: The purpose of the property is to expose itself in the designer and provide a button to click on to show the about box of the grid.
member.remarks: The property always returns null. The property type editor exposes a button tha opens the about box of the exporter.
